column1: PRE EDIT:
req2    On-line authentication must take place between the card issuer and the CEP card for load
req29   The transaction signatures ensure end to end integrity of transmitted data for load
req49   If a scheme provider establishes a central error repository
column2: all transactions for the scheme with MAC errors must be sent to that central error repository whether or not they are submitted to the dispute process .

column1: req72   Payment decisions are based on signature validations
column3: and merchant and merchant acquirer agreements .

column1: req77   All load transactions are on-line transactions. Authorization of funds for load transactions must require a form of cardholder verification. The load device must support on-line encrypted PIN or off-line PIN verification .
req84   Flexibility is required to accommodate the variety of environments where unlinked loads may be implemented. As a result
column2: the design specification must not preclude dual-leg transactions** from taking place either sequentially or in parallel. The design of a given implementation will vary depending on the device

column1: req85   Unload and currency exchange transactions are optional for CEP card issuers. The CEP card must indicate whether the card issuer supports these transactions. However
column2: if a card issuer issues multi-currency capable cards
column3: it must provide its cardholder with a facility to remove any remaining value. As a result
column4: if a card issuer supports loading of multiple currencies onto a card
column5: then it must support the unload or currency exchange transaction or both. .

column1: req90   Script messages that conform to EMV specifications may be included as part of load
column2: unload and currency exchange messages from the card issuer to the CEP card. An update key must be used when card parameters are changed. Script messages may be sent to the CEP card either before or after the credit for load
column3: debit of unload and currency exchange commands. .

column1: req95   It is a card issuer decision to determine the currencies that are allowed to occupy slots in the CEP card. This decision is made by the card issuer during the load or currency exchange transaction
column2: by approving or rejecting the request to authorize the transaction. .

column1: req108  Load and unload functions must be authenticated using end-to-end security between the card and the card issuer .
req109  The issuer host must authenticate the card upon the load/unload request .
